lead_paragraph: HADDOW--Robert S.,94, of Greenwich, CT died February 17, 2016. Born in New Castle, PA on September 30, 1921, he was the son of the late George and Agnes Haddow. Raised in California, he proudly attained the rank of Eagle Scout while in the Boy Scouts. Robert graduated from the California Maritime Academy in 1942 and went to sea with Moore-McCormack Lines, serving as chief engineer during World War II. He graduated from the University of California at Berkeley in 1947 with a degree in ocean transportation. He held various administrative positions with Tidewater Oil Company until 1964. He moved to New York to join Standard Oil Co. of Indiana (Amoco) rising to the position of president of Amoco Shipping Company. In 1975, he was appointed shipping advisor to The Burmah Oil Company Ltd. to help resolve the company's tanker crisis. He later served as chief executive of Burmah Oil Tankers and president of Burmah Oil Shipping. He joined Ultramar in 1980 as senior vice president. Before retiring he held the position of president of American Maritime Transport. Robert had a great love of dogs, particularly for Labrador Retrievers, Petit Basset Griffon Vendeens, and one Wire-Hair Fox Terrier. He enjoyed traveling, especially to Scotland where both his parents came from. His hobbies included salmon fishing, grouse shooting, and golfing. Known as "Grumpy" to his grandchildren, he was funny, wise, and generous. Robert is survived by his wife of 65 years, Virginia Dillingham Haddow, daughter Susan Haddow, daughter-in-law Amy Haddow and four grandsons: Tyler, Peter, Matthew, and Michael. A son, Robert Haddow, predeceased him. Services and interment are private. Memorial Contributions may be made to The Boy Scouts of America, www.scouting.org. 1/3
